content:
As an AI language model, I do not have access to the internal strategies of Comic Relief. However, from external sources, it seems that the pandemic has greatly affected the fundraising and operational models of Comic Relief. Due to the pandemic, many of Comic Relief's fundraising events had to be canceled or postponed, which led to a significant reduction in their income. Additionally, the pandemic also impacted their operations and projects, inhibiting their ability to carry out their work on the ground.

As a result, Comic Relief had to adapt quickly to the changing circumstances, with a focus on digital fundraising efforts and developing new ways to engage donors virtually. They launched a virtual fundraising campaign, featuring live-streamed events and remote challenges to raise money. Comic Relief also utilized social media platforms to raise awareness and encourage donations. 

Additionally, Comic Relief has had to reevaluate their long-term strategy and the types of projects they support. The pandemic has highlighted the need for more support and focused efforts on disadvantaged communities, and Comic Relief has responded by prioritizing funding for projects that address these issues.

Overall, the pandemic has forced Comic Relief to be more agile and flexible in its operations and fundraising efforts, and it has also emphasized the importance of focusing on long-term sustainability in its projects.
